page.p: - If the size of this book doesn't allow an optimal reading, it is suggested to set the GUI scale to 0 in the Guidebook configuration "gbook.cfg" or a suiting combination with the game GUI scale.

- This mod works better with other tech mods introducing metals and other materials to quickly share common resources, since the key is the production of uncommon or non-minable resources usable later in the game.

- This book tries to describe all the parts of the mod and the steps to proceed into it. The table of contents is divided into the main arguments, each one splitted into chapters. Each chapter contains sorted lists of documentation.
- For a faster navigation, clicking on the indexes leads you to the proper page, while clicking on the red page titles leads you back to its direct parent index.
- Search for the Chemistry Quest Book in JEI for a progressive quest line to assembly the entire factory.

- This mod roughly depicts the production of various resources from an industrial chemistry point of view. It involves processes to analyze an unidentified mineral, acknowledge its composition and progressively treat what is exposed to collect their bearing elements. There is not a proper goal line, but assembling the factory and involving the player with choices and strategies are part of the mod's spirit.

- The tech tree is made of several converging branches, working on their own or feeding eachother, concerning the acquiring of primary resources and their processing into advanced ones for further usage.

- In its basic form, at the end of the chain there is a set of ingredients usable to gate features at given game phases, mostly in late-game. Each machine is also customizable with external recipes, so that each one can be used outside the mod mechanics, to differentiate or spread the pack recipes.

Most of the devices are multiblock structures made of orientable elements connected to eachother. Some of them are provided of a gui, to operate the main functions or just delegated to hold an ingredient of the performed recipe. Some elements are 2 blocks tall and placed at once, hence considered as a single unit. Hitting each element with the mod wrench will rotate clockwise the block.

To assembly a structure, this guide uses a grid system for every layer composing it, from the lowest to the highest. Each layer is shown "as seen from above", with the position of every component in the grid and a red arrow indicating their orientation relative to the rest of the structure. Components without the orientation arrow can be freely placed. Slots marked with colored borders, indicate if a block is delegated to powering (red), input tasks (blue) or output tasks (orange). If a block handles only a specific fluid or gas, it will be also shown inside the slot.

Structures offer a large amount of hooks for transportation and powering systems. Each element uses colored plugs just for reference, but unless warned in the structure chapters, piping can be managed from any side. Also, blocks delegated to handle a specific fluid and gas are automatically filtered for that resource.
Colored plugs roughly tell what kind of piping the block handles:
- Green plugs indicate that the block can move dusts via the Dust Pipeline.
- Blue plugs indicate that the block can accept ingredients.
- Orange plugs indicate that the block can extract products.
- Gold plugs refers to generic connections between parts of the structure.
- Red plugs indicate that the element must be connected to the Power Station.
It activates the structure or single elements. If a recipe selector is available, the structure may need to be activated before the correct ingredients can be accepted.
When available, sliders increase or decrease their related parameter.

While visible, it indicates that a redstone signal is overriding the button function. Redstone overriding can be used for activation purposes or to set a parameter by the signal's power level (0 to 15).
Where available, the slot accepts tiered Speed Upgrades. There are 7 tiers, speeding the process up to 8 times.
If active on top of the gui, it allows to access the machine JEI recipe tabs. The standard I/O colored arrows indicate if items are ingredients or the result of the recipe.
While hovered with the cursor, this icon shows useful information about the related machine and the recipe being processed. It should always be consulted.

In guis with this slot system, the handled ingredient can be automatically cycled by the recipe selector so to be pushed for extraction while a different one is injected. It helps the Server to schedule recipes.

Every structure is provided of a special plug which allows a redstone signal to override the manual activation. It can be useful to control and temporize the activity of each structure inside the factory:
It can be located in a different spot inside each structure and it's the only side where a valid signal can be acquired from repeaters, redstone wires or any powered block.

Fluid tanks and gas vessels, can be set to provide a steady redstone signal to a comparator attached to them once a certain threashold in the stored amount is reached. This is useful to control the amount of produced material or to turn on/off a device depending on available resources.
There are three available modes:
> By redstone level:
A redstone signal from 0 to 15, will be provided depending on the stored quantity, where 15 equals to a full tank.
> High past threashold:
Once the stored amount passes the assigned precentage (in steps of 5%), it will provide a high signal.
> Low past threashold:
Once the stored amount passes the assigned precentage (in steps of 5%), the provided high level signal will turn low.
The mod uses different ways to quantify resources, some common to any mod, some specific for the mod.
> Fuel Power: it is expressed in ticks. It equals to the burntime of regular fuel or the efficiency of additional burnable resources.
> Gases: gases are quantified in 'cu' (cubic unit), where 1cu can be roughly compared to 1Bucket for fluids.
> Elements: some machines use fraction of the element dusts, so they are quantified in 'ppc' (Parts-Per-Craft), where 1 dust is made of 100ppc by default.

Some of the machines use consumables for their processes. They are damageable items that will slowly get consumed and needing a replacement. All of them are anyway enchantable with Unbreaking to last longer or with mending to have a chance to repair themselves over time.
In case of catalysts, there is available a specific process that is able to clean and recover them from being definitely spent. It is the Catalyst Regeneration.

The production chain requires some supporting material to be steadly running. They are vanilla supplies like coal, granite, redstone and water. Being them the base for almost every process, their afflux needs to be constant and strong.

Ore supplying is represented by veins of Uninspected mineral, which generate in any whitelisted dimension with stone in the underground. Being the only source for materials, vein parameters should be accordingly set to ensure abundance in any area. Uninspected Minerals set the start of the processing chain being crushed on the Mineral Sizer.

Gangues are mixtures of minerals trapped in the raw ore exposed by crushing the Uninspected mineral. Gangue represent the first stage of the classification, each one exposing certain types of specimen.
Specimens are stable shards recovered from their gangue after an exposure to specific substances. Shards are minerals composed by one or more chemical elements following a specific formula.

Chemical elements are obtained in their dust form by accumulating little quantities from extracting processes and can be used as supply in tech environments. The quantity of the extracted element roughly reflects the precentages listed when moving the cursor over the specimens.
Some elements are common and have an high availability. They are there just for completion and surplus as usually minable from other mods.
Uncommom elements are those usually unavailable as an ore in the world, requiring to be extracted.
Rare Earth Elements are the rarest elements to be found and require quite a lot of resources to be collected in decent amounts, setting an ultimate achievement.
Fluids:
Most of the fluids used by the mod are acids dealing damage (which can be disabled from the config). They can be handled as usual with any moving system.
Gases:
In Minecraft gases are fluids marked as "gaseous" (depicted by a flipped bucket icon). Inside the mod, gases are handled only in vessels and moved through a Gas Pipeline.
Fluid Category:

The Fluidpedia provides some parameters which tell the way a fluid can be stored inside the mod tanks. It roughly depends on Density and Viscosity. While Light Fluids can be held in a Fluid Tank, Heavy Fluids require a Heavy Drum to be stored.
Af = (D + V) / 2
Kf = V / D
Light Fluid: Af<=3500 and Kf<=1.50
Heavy Fluid: Af>3500 or Kf>1.50

The mod has its own optional powering system, based on the production of Syngas, entirely sustained by water and coal. Syngas can be injected in the Power Station to produce Fuel Power and RF for the structure, as well as RF for external uses.
How to set the Syngas Path:
1- Assembly a Mineral Sizer and turn Coal Blocks into Cracked Coal.
2- Place a Slurry Pond and feed it with Cracked Coal and Water to obtain Coal Slurry.
3- Assembly a Gasification Plant and feed it with water and Coal Slurry to obtain Raw Syngas.
4- Assembly a Gas Purifier and feed it with Raw Syngas to refine it into Syngas.
5- Stock the Syngas in Gas Holders. Set a Gas Pipeline path, dedicated to the Syngas delivery to all the structures.
6- Feed each Power Station with Syngas to produce Fuel Power. Add a Gas Turbine in the Redstone slot to produce also RF.
This mod produces several alloys as an immediate application of the processes. They are roughly depicted by their characteristics and their real composition.
Alloys
Alloys are implemented with their set of items and oredicted to be integrated in recipes.
The Mischmetal alloy has the ability to generate sparks if walking on it while wearing boots.
Parts

For additional applications, alloys and metals can produce extra parts. They can be common ingredients for late-game technical recipes, like gears, plates and molten metals for Tinker Construct, as well as for trading purposes, like coins.
This is the element handling the power supply inside the mod. It can passively provide power to the structures or be used as a RF generator. It can produce Fuel Power or Redstone Flux.
> Fuel Power is generated by any burnable item, Syngas, lava or converted from external RF (by applying an Induction Heating Interface to the fuel slot).
> RF is generated by redstone, Syngas (by applying a Gas Turbine to the redstone slot) or directly injected from external sources.

Once connected to a structure, the two modules will be automatically handled to show which type of fuel it is required (fuel, RF, both). The switch in the middle allows to independently provide RF to blocks in front of it. It should be turned off while connected to a structure. External RF can be inserted from any conduit, Syngas can be inserted from the back only through a Gas Pipeline.

Cabinets allow to interface ingredients in structures. There are two type of cabinets: the Element and the Material cabinet. The first type holds the elements being processed by the mod, while the second type holds elements injected via CraftTweaker. They are 2 blocks tall: the lower part is the proper material storage, while the upper part works as injector for the storage and requires a Graduated Cylinder to quantify the inserted material. When required, on its output side, it's possible to connect a Lab Balance, which turns stored elements back to the item form. An hopper or any item extractor can be attached to the balance to move these items.

This basic tank stores Light Fluids. It is provided of a filter to handle a specific fluid by using a Sampling Ampoule and slots to also handle fluids directly from the gui other than using buckets on the tank. A void slot allows to clean the tank from its content.
The Heavy Drum is dedicated to store Heavy Fluids, very dense and viscous fluids, which cannot be held in the basic tank. It has the same handling properties though.

The Containment Tank is an advanced tank, part of the Hazard and Pollution feature. It allows to contain Light Fluids without the risk of any pollutant leaking. By pressing U on it, JEI will tell which are the hazardous fluids.

This is a tank capable to contain gases. Vessels are unidirectional, with fixed input and output marked with colored plugs. It roughly depicts the filled bucket of regular fluids, containing only 1cu of gas and can transfer only through the Gas Pipeline. Its gui allows to filter the input by using a Sampling Ampoule or void the tank, losing the content. If kept at full capacity over a long period, it may collapse and explode by the Hazard and Pollution feature.
The Gas Holder is the high tier pressure vessel capable to contain 1000cu of gas and is two blocks tall. It has the same characteristics of the lower tier.

The Server allows the structures incorporating it to automatically schedule multiple recipes in a cycle as long as ingredients are constantly supplied. For the cycle, it uses Server Files in which to inscribe all the informations about the recipe to perform. A cycle can execute up to 9 files in the order they are placed inside the cabinet (left to right). Once activated, the Server overrides the recipe handler of the structure. Turning it off, the controlled structure returns to its regular duty.
How to set the Server:
1- Put a Server File into the inscriber slot.
2a- Select the recipe or the variable parameter, depending on the structure and its recipes.
2b- Choose how many times it must perform the selected recipe.
2c- When enabled, if necessary set an item filter or fluid filter by a Sampling Ampoule, depending on the type of recipe.
2d- Choose if the file must be endlessly repeated after the cabinet cycle is over. Non repeatable files will be skipped once done.
3- Save the file. A tooltip will show the settings. Saved files can be regenerated anytime with new values at the same way.
4- Put the saved file in the cabinet in the planned order.
5- Activate the Server when all the files are in place inside the cabinet. The structure should be always activated after the server.

The Exhaust Valve is a block related to the Hazard and Pollution feature. It allows to release the pressure of any vessel or holder if kept too long at full capacity, preventing a collapsing. It has a configurable tolerance and a percentage of released gas for when the critical point is reached. Tolerance and its current progression are shown in screen overlays like HWYLA or TheOneProbe. If the contained gas is marked as pollutant, when released it will generate a toxic cloud around the vessel which will dissolve after a while. By pressing U on the Pressure Vessel, JEI will tell which gases are hazardous.

The Fluidpedia is an utility block that allows to pick samples of fluids and gases for filtering purposes inside the mod. It works by using a Sampling Ampoule on any of the available slots. A tooltip provides additional informations like type and temperature, which are reliavant for some of the machines. To better address the search, a selector allows to filter the materials by character (A-Z) or by type (Fluid/Gas/All). The filled ampoule must then be used on the filter slot of the interested machine.

The Fluid Pipeline is a moving system between fluid handlers. A fluid line is composed of a Pump connected to the sending tank and a Valve to the receiving tanks, joined by Ducts. By default, the pump moves 1 bucket per cycle, upgraded to 100 buckets by using a Compressing Unit on it. The valve has a gui in which to separately filter each of the free sides.
How to set the Fluid Pipeline:
- To start working, pump and valve must be activated with bare hands while sneaking.
- Hitting the pump with the mod wrench sets an increasing delay (hit while sneaking to decrease), ticking less intensively to save performance.
- Both the delay and the lenght of the line may influence the efficiency of the pipeline. It is suggested to create the shortest path possible, avoiding loops.
- Using a Compressing Unit on the pump, will apply the upgrade, while using the wrench on the pump will remove it.
- Using the wrench on a duct changes its color, meaning that path is now barred and the fluid cannot reach its destination.

The Gas Pipeline is a moving system between the mod's gas handlers. A gas line is composed of a Pump connected to the output of the sending handler and Ducts connected to the input of the receiving handlers. The pump alone can already transfer gas without ducts. It transfers by default 1cu of gas per cycle, upgraded to 10cu by using a Compressing Unit on it.
How to set the Gas Pipeline:
- To start working, the pump must be activated with bare hands while sneaking.
- Hitting the pump with the mod wrench sets an increasing delay (hit while sneaking to decrease), ticking less intensively to save performance.
- Both the delay and the lenght of the line may influence the efficiency of the pipeline. It is suggested to create the shortest path possible, avoiding loops.
- Using a Compressing Unit on the pump, will apply the upgrade, while using the wrench on the pump will remove it.
- Using the wrench on a duct changes its color, meaning that path is now barred and the gas cannot reach its destination.

The Dust Pipeline is a moving system able to connect Materials Cabinets and Elements Cabinets to others of the same kind in order to create a master storage system for the dusts being produced around the factory.
How to set the Dust Pipeline:
- To start working, the pump must be activated with bare hands while sneaking.
- The pump must be placed at the side of the sending cabinet, replacing the Lab Balance, while the ducts must connect at the back of the receiving cabinet.
- The lenght of the line may influence the efficiency of the pipeline. It is suggested to create the shortest path possible, avoiding loops.
- Using the wrench on a duct changes its color, meaning that path is now barred and the dust cannot reach its destination.

The Planning Table is an utility block that allows to construct all the multiblock structures of the mod. It must be placed in front of an open area with enough space to arrange the structure. Once selected the structure and filled the slots with the required amount of parts, the Build button will assembly them.
Chemistry Wrench

This tool allows to interact with some blocks and machines to alter their function or rotation. It can be used by right clicking, left clicking, while sneaking or not during the action. The various chapters explain when it's possible to use it and how.
Tile Nullifier
This debug item allows to reset and drop any of the machines, by using it on them, if their tile entity gets permanently corrupted or causing crashes when trying to interact with them.
Sampling Ampoule
This item allows to pick a sample of gas or fluid from the Fluidpedia to set a filter inside tanks or vessels able to filter their input.
Induction Heating Interface
This item must be placed in the fuel slot of the Power Station. It allows to convert the external incoming RF into Fuel Power to supply the structures.
Gas Turbine
This item must be placed in the redstone slot of the Power Station and allows to use Syngas for the production of RF.

This device allows to collect water from a source tile. It must be placed on top of it and turned on with any redstone signal. Water will be slowly collected in its internal tank and can be extracted with any fluid trasport system. It has 2 combined upgrades.
- Compression: the Compressing unit improves the water aspiration by making it persistent and double the effect of the impeller.
- Flow: tiered impellers improve the efficiency of the pump. They can be swapped by using a new one on the machine.
- Iron Impeller: 200 mb/t
- Aluminum Impeller: 1000 mb/t
- Stellite Impeller: 2000 mb/t
Assembled by Planning Table

The air compressor allows to produce Compressed Air, a basic gas used in some process inside the mod. The device is already provided of a own fuel system, so no additional Power Station is required. Once activated, the compressing unit simply pushes air inside the attached container for storage.

The Evaporation Tank is a small container fillable with water, slowly evaporating to reveal a layer of Raw Salt. This layer can be manually harvested by using a shovel on top of the tank or extracted with an hopper or pipes. Raw salt must be prosessed in the Seasoning Rack to be refined into common salt. The evaporation process involves several environmental occurrencies:
> Using the wrench on the tank will change the extractible fluid by using pipes. This can turn the tank into a rain collector. Extracted fluids cannot be processed in the tank anymore.
> If it rains, the empty tank slowly fills itself.
> Rain collecting does not happen in biomes with no rain.
> The evaporation advances on daytime, stopping at night.
> The tank must always see the sky to evaporate.
> If it rains at any stage of the evaporation, the salt will melt again in the water after a configurable amount of time.
> Evaporation changes through biomes: faster in hot biomes, slower in cold and wet biomes.
> Altitudes above y=120 speed up the evaporation compared to lower levels.
> A blacklist sets dimensions where evaporation cannot happen.
> A whitelist for "no-air" or "space" dimensions sets places where the evaporation is replaced by desublimation, causing the immediate revealing of a poorer raw salt at a lower water rate.
The Seasoning Rack is an unpowered device operating as an object processor, where ingredients can be turned into others after an interval.

It is an unpowered device to unify fluids or gases into one variant. It also allows gases from other mods to be imported inside RH, as well as gases created by RH to be exported outside the mod. To import a gas, any pipe will work and the gas can be picked by the Gas Pipeline at the front. To export a gas, it needs a vessel at the input and a pipe to any side to move it outside. In case of fluids any pipe will work. The two switches select the process.
It works via CraftTweaker. To import or export, the script must contain the same material for both input and output, while to unify, the input needs to be turned into the desired variant.

The Chemical Dumper is an unpowered machine that allows to dynamically void unwanted fluids or gases. It is provided of an internal filter to set the accepted input and can connect to any fluid pipe or the Gas Pipeline, giving a final destination to the material to dump.
Assembled by Planning Table
It allows to blend different ingredients into a mixture. It is a two blocks tall machine where the controller beneath handles the operations while the upper tank holds the ingredients.
Ingredients can be freely inserted as long as they are the required ones for the correct recipe to be recognized. The output is shown in the preview inside the controller.

A memory system allows to lock the slots to accept only specific ingredients. Switching ON the lock while ingredients are in the slots, they will be stored in the memory. Switching OFF the lock will reset the memory.
Assembled by Planning Table

The Profiling Bench is an unpowered machine that allows to reshape materials into parts with different patterns to choose from. It can be interacted straight away by right-clicking the block to insert or extract the items or handled with hoppers and pipes.

The device has a selector in front of the press, showing the possible shapes and it can be scrolled by punching the block (punch while sneaking to scroll backward). Inserting a valid ingredient on the machine, it gets placed under the press, thet will start moving. Once done, the new item will appear and can be extracted by clicking on the machine again.
Assembled by Planning Table

The Heat Exchanger processes gases by cooling them through a coolant liquid system. The lower is the coolant temperature, the less energy and coolant are consumed in the process. Informations about the temperatures can be found inside the Fluidpedia. For a recipe to be valid, the output gas must have a lower temperature than the input gas, while a vald coolant must have its temperature lower than the ambient value (300K ingame).
Assembled by Planning Table
It compresses gases into their liquid state following the Expansion Ratio 1/N. It works in opposition to the Expanion Chamber, sharing the same recipes with inverted factors.
Assembled by Planning Table
It expands fluids into their gas state following the Expansion Ratio 1/N. It works in opposition to the Gas Condenser, sharing the same recipes with inverted factors.
Assembled by Planning Table

The Catalyst Regenerator replenishes the durability of spent catalysts, beneath any structure which uses catalysts in their recipes or to function. It requires Flue Gas to clean the catalyst and water to wash it at the end. As a side effect of the cleaning process, a coke compound can be left behind.
It must be oriented with the row of plugs on top of it matching those under the monitored structure. When activated, once any catalyst drops its durability below 25%, it gets replenished.
Monitored Blocks
Precipitation Chamber: Controller
Lab Oven: Controller
Gas Reforming: Controller
Chemical Extractor: Stabilizer
Fixed Bed Reactor: Controller
Assembled by Planning Table

The Slurry Pond is an unpowered device producing a fluid substance by the maceration of a solid ingredient in a fluid solvent. Its speed and efficiency are defined by the concentration of the process, which is controlled by a slider.
> High concentration (green area)
Dense smaller scale process.
Consumes less ingredients and yields less slurry, but it outputs at a faster rate.
> Low concentration (red area)
Diluted larger scale process.
Consumes more ingredients and yields more slurry, but requires more time to output.
The gui monitor indicates the required ingredients and their managed quantity, as well as the process time.
Assembled by Planning Table

The Mineral Sizer allows to crush materials based on how fine the grain of the product must be (comminution). The smaller this grain is meant to be, the heavier the process can be, requiring more power, time and gear wearing.
Once added an input ingredient, changing the comminution sliders exposes the correct output.
Crushing Gears are consumed accordingly to the comminution, so the first gear in line breaks faster than the last.
Assembled by Planning Table
The Shaking Table Separator allows to crush materials and separate them by their weight through a water stream. It can output a heavy product, as well as finer byproduct material and a fluid sludge.
Assembled by Planning Table
The Continous Stirred Tank Reactor produces solutions by mixing fluids, eventually requiring voltage. A gaseous byproduct can be optionally produced.

It takes to set a filter on both input tanks by using the Sampling Ampoule and feed the two fluids according to the Primary and Secondary ingredient of the recipe. If the recipe requires a voltage with the related icon being active, it must be fed accordingly by injecting RF through the Power Station. Also, if the recipe includes a gaseous byproduct, it will be stored in the vessel.
Assembled by Planning Table
The Precipitation chamber allows to produce fluid and solid materials by the reaction of different ingredients.

Ingredients and fluids are automatically handled, allowing to connect the structure to a storage network. The reactor accepts two types of solid ingredients: a solute and/or a catalyst. While the solute is consumed each process, the catalyst is only damaged.
The reactor has two possible outputs: a mandatory solution pumped in the Buffer Tank and an optional solid by-product, collected in the lower chamber of the reactor.
Assembled by Planning Table
The Gasification Plant produces gases by the reaction of solvents at high temperatures past a threashold value.
It takes to feed the Power Station constantly with fuel to raise the temperature. Once reached the threashold, it starts producing. While inactive, the temperature slowly decreases.
The structure used Refractory Casing upgrade to improve the heating/cooling factors but it has a rare chance to break when increasing the speed upgrade.
Assembled by Planning Table

It allows to perform a purifying process on a gas to obtain a refined one. The structure is managed by the purifying controller which moves the input gas through the turbine to be purified, leaving behind eventually some byproduct.
Assembled by Planning Table

The Powder Mixer allows to create compounds made of dusts by mixing a percentage of them for a finer dosage. It uses the 'ppc' unit hence it takes the input from the cabinets. A selector in the controller shows the available recipes and their ingredients.
Assembled by Planning Table

The Lab Oven allows to produce solutions by the reaction of different ingredients which can be fluid, solid or catalysts. By selecting a recipe to perform in the controller, all the ingredients are automatically handled, allowing to connect the structure to a storage network. The oven has two possible outputs: a mandatory Solution and an optional fluid by-product.
Assembled by Planning Table
It exposes specimens contained inside gangues by acid attacks, through 3 phases. Aside the recovered specimen it produces leachate for further processing.
It uses a Slurry Agitator on each of the Sealed Vats to move the substance in the sludge as well as steam to keep the suspension active.
It's possible to select a Specific Gravity to expose the needed specimen. Exposed specimens can be seen by hovering the lens icon as an output is found.
Filters can also be upgraded to tighten the selector range.
Assembled by Planning Table
This is the second stage of the leaching system. It does a finer analysis of a leachate to recover finer specimens.
It uses a Slurry Agitator on each of the Sealed Vats to move the substance in the sludge as well as steam to keep the suspension active.
It's possible to select a Specific Gravity to expose the needed specimen. Exposed specimens can be seen by hovering the lens icon as an output is found.
Filters can also be upgraded to tighten the selector range.
Assembled by Planning Table
The Crystal Pulling Crucible creates synthetic crystals by mixing a melting compound while altered by a doping element inside an environment full of Argon.

The melting ingredient goes in the lower section of the crucible while the dopant goes in the middle section. Turning on the machine, the chamber starts to heat up to the melting point where the pulling process begins.
Assembled by Planning Table
It processes materials by the exposure to gases at certain temperatures and pressures.
It takes two upgrades in the lower chamber. The Insulation Upgrade reduces temperature and pressure leaking. The Casing Upgrade reinforces the chamber speeding the pressurizing.
The process starts once the temperature and pressure raises til the recipe threashold. After every process the device loses most of its parameters that need to be restored again.
Assembled by Planning Table
The Metal Alloyer casts alloys by combining different elements in a different quantity and formed a Mold Pattern.
The recipe is shown by hovering the cursor on the checklist. A full green recipe means it is ready to cast. Additional ingredients can be supplied from the upper section of the cabinets.
Assembled by Planning Table
It produces a gas compound by the interaction of gases with a pack catalysts. It can use up to 8 catalysts, each one multiplying the handled quantities.
Assembled by Planning Table

This plant allows to extract elements through the air separation process, storing them inside holders. Some of the extracted gases are extremely rare, requiring a lot of energy and time to be properly acquired.

The plant is splitted into three channels, to get Nitrogen, Oxygen and rare gases. There are 6 extractible rare gases, each one with a different rarity. Each channel can work on a separate duty. The plant consumes energy depending on how many channels are operating at the same time.
Assembled by Planning Table

The Reforming Reactor produces gas and fluid compounds by the reaction of two gases. It takes 2 series of catalysts, the which combination determines the efficiency of the reactor. The 6 system catalyst are structure related while the 4 reaction catalysts change with the recipe.
System Catalysts
Tier1: NiAl
Tier2: Graphite
Tier3: White Gold
Reaction Catalysts
Tier1: Gold
Tier2: See Recipes
Assembled by Planning Table

It decomposes the specimens to isolate the chemical elements. The reaction is controlled by its intensity. If the quantity of each element composing a specimen is lower than 20%, the intensity becomes irrilevant and the lowest is the more profitable while higher intensities may consume more the compound. The gui monitors indicate the state of the reactor.

The high chance the acids decompose the material loosing product makes necessary to stabilize the reaction so to preserve as much as possible the final extracted product. So it takes 6 Ferrous Catalysts to the Reaction Stabilizer.

This mob is related to the Hazard and Pollution feature. It spawns if there is Toxic Sludge from tanks spilled in the world. It is small but moves and leaps fast and is immune to acid damage, targeting the player which will get damage and poisoning if attacked. When killed it drops Toxic Slimeball. Currently no uses are added for this item.
Assembled by Planning Table

This device detects and picks any experience orb inside a configurable radius. Orbs will be instantly grabbed and their value kept inside the storage. The detection radius depends on the magnetic probes. A selector inside the gui allows to retrieve levels from the storage. The machines is connected to a cistern from where it is possible to recycle the Toxic Waste and Toxic Sludge. This recycling allows a 50% chance to double the value of the orb. Also, if any modded liquid xp is available, the stored xp can be handled as the selected Liquid XP and drained from the sedimentation tank below the machine with any piping system.
The device needs to be activated to start collecting the orbs. Probes are made of common materials and advanced alloys. Hovering the cursor on them will show the provided radius.

The Disposer is an unpowered device that allows to drop simultaneously one item from each of its internal slots at a configured interval in ticks. Dropped items appear in front of the device. Slots can be also locked so only each one involved can receive that specific item.

Didymium Glass is a blurred glass which allows to filter the light, creating dark rooms which are yet visible from the outside. It is made in the Metal Alloyer by a mixture of Rare Earths Elements and filtered sand. It is available in three themes (borderless, bordered and bricks).
Toxic Waste

This is the byproduct of several chemical reactions. It deal damage touching it and has the configurable ability to drop few experience when killing entities. It also has the ability to mutate items into others by tossing them into it.
Toxic Sludge

This is a leaking fluid occurring when a mod tank contains a fluid marked as "pollutant", causing nearby pollution over time. It is toxic too and has the ability to generate Toxic Slimes. To prevent pollution, pollutant fluids should be quickly stored inside a Containment Tank.
Gas pressure hazard

Keeping any of the mod gas handlers (vessels, holders, devices) at its full capacity over a long period of time, may lead it to collape and explode. Gases should be stored in large holders taking care to leave a bit of capacity tolerance so to allow the stabilization. In any case, it is possible to use Exhaust Valves on top of the vessels, which will take care to unload part of the content to keep the pressure under control. If the contained gas being released is marked as "pollutant", it may create a temporary toxic cloud around the tank.

Silicone is a dense compound produced in the lab oven, that is required to craft the Silicone Cartridge. This tool allows to produce slime balls when clicked in air while sneaking, or to place slime blocks in world when used on a surface. It can be also used in crafting recipes in place of slime balls, damaging the tool after each crafting.
Gunpowder can be chemically produced in mass by extracting its main ingredients through various type of manipulation, also using some chemical reactions and mixing them to obtain the final compound.

Artificial snow is made by creating in the Lab Oven the Sodium Polyacrylate polymer. It can be used in a cauldron full of water. The fluid is absorbed by the compoound generating a snow block. Alternatively, the item can be tossed into the water for the reaction to happen in place. Snow blocks can be mined as usual.
The waterlock is an high tier sponge simulant allowing to clean a larger amount of water. It works the same way as a vanilla sponge by placing it in water and smelting it to dry when wet.
